main event: Numerous observers sighted one to seven silver-like oval objects in Memphis, Tennessee on 7 April 1949.
interesting points: The objects were reported to be very large and brilliant, visible by reflection., The objects exhibited erratic motion, including clockwise whirling, diving, and climbing., Witnesses described the objects as the size of gallon jars., No aircraft or meteorological phenomena were reported that could explain the sightings., Observations lasted between 2 to 3 hours, and the objects disappeared suddenly.
sighted object: one to seven silver-like oval objects
witness description: Various residents including a housewife and a registered nurse.
